intro: Galium tricorne var. laeve, commonly known as the smooth three-angled bedstraw, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically smooth and lanceolate in shape. The flowers are usually white or pale green, occurring in clusters at the leaf axils, and are followed by small, capsule-like fruits. This variety is native to parts of Europe and is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Galium genus, with its unique three-angled stem being a notable trait.
